src/QueryPath/CssParser.php
Go to the documentation of this file.
00001 <?php
00002 /** @file
00003  * CSS selector parsing classes.
00004  *
00005  * This file contains the tools necessary for parsing CSS 3 selectors.
00006  * In the future it may be expanded to handle all of CSS 3.
00007  *
00008  * The parser contained herein is has an event-based API. Implementors should
00009  * begin by implementing the {@link CssEventHandler} interface. For an example
00010  * of how this is done, see {@link CssEventHandler.php}.
00011  *
00012  * @author M Butcher <matt@aleph-null.tv>
00013  * @license http://opensource.org/licenses/lgpl-2.1.php The GNU Lesser GPL (LGPL) or an MIT-like license. 
00014  */
00015 
00016 /** @addtogroup querypath_css CSS Parsing
00017  * QueryPath includes a CSS 3 Selector parser.
00018  *
00019  *
00020  * Typically the parser is not accessed directly. Most developers will use it indirectly from
00021  * qp(), htmlqp(), or one of the methods on a QueryPath object.
00022  *
00023  * This parser is modular and is not tied to QueryPath, so you can use it in your 
00024  * own (non-QueryPath) projects if you wish. To dive in, start with CssEventHandler, the
00025  * event interface that works like a SAX API for CSS selectors. If you want to check out
00026  * the details, check out the parser (CssParser),  scanner (CssScanner), and token list (CssToken).
00027  */
00028 
00029 require_once 'CssEventHandler.php';
00030 
00031 
00032 /**
00033  * An event handler for handling CSS 3 Selector parsing.
00034  *
00035  * This provides a standard interface for CSS 3 Selector event handling. As the 
00036  * parser parses a selector, it will fire events. Implementations of CssEventHandler
00037  * can then handle the events.
00038  *
00039  * This library is inspired by the SAX2 API for parsing XML. Each component of a 
00040  * selector fires an event, passing the necessary data on to the event handler.
00041  *
00042  * @ingroup querypath_css
00043  */
00044 interface CssEventHandler {
00045   /** The is-exactly (=) operator. */
00046   const isExactly = 0; // = 
00047   /** The contains-with-space operator (~=). */
00048   const containsWithSpace = 1; // ~=
00049   /** The contains-with-hyphen operator (!=). */
00050   const containsWithHyphen = 2; // |=
00051   /** The contains-in-string operator (*=). */
00052   const containsInString = 3; // *=
00053   /** The begins-with operator (^=). */
00054   const beginsWith = 4; // ^=
00055   /** The ends-with operator ($=). */
00056   const endsWith = 5; // $=
00057   /** The any-element operator (*). */
00058   const anyElement = '*';
00059   
00060   /**
00061    * This event is fired when a CSS ID is encountered.
00062    * An ID begins with an octothorp: #name.
00063    *
00064    * @param string $id
00065    *  The ID passed in.
00066    */
00067   public function elementID($id); // #name
00068   /**
00069    * Handle an element name.
00070    * Example: name
00071    * @param string $name
00072    *  The name of the element.
00073    */
00074   public function element($name); // name
00075   /**
00076    * Handle a namespaced element name.
00077    * example: namespace|name
00078    * @param string $name
00079    *  The tag name.
00080    * @param string $namespace
00081    *  The namespace identifier (Not the URI)
00082    */
00083   public function elementNS($name, $namespace = NULL);
00084   /**
00085    * Handle an any-element (*) operator.
00086    * Example: *
00087    */
00088   public function anyElement(); // *
00089   /**
00090    * Handle an any-element operator that is constrained to a namespace.
00091    * Example: ns|*
00092    * @param string $ns
00093    *  The namespace identifier (not the URI).
00094    */
00095   public function anyElementInNS($ns); // ns|*
00096   /**
00097    * Handle a CSS class selector.
00098    * Example: .name
00099    * @param string $name 
00100    *  The name of the class.
00101    */
00102   public function elementClass($name); // .name
00103   /**
00104    * Handle an attribute selector.
00105    * Example: [name=attr]
00106    * Example: [name~=attr]
00107    * @param string $name
00108    *  The attribute name.
00109    * @param string $value
00110    *  The value of the attribute, if given.
00111    * @param int $operation
00112    *  The operation to be used for matching. See {@link CssEventHandler}
00113    *  constants for a list of supported operations.
00114    */
00115   public function attribute($name, $value = NULL, $operation = CssEventHandler::isExactly); // [name=attr]
00116   /**
00117    * Handle an attribute selector bound to a specific namespace.
00118    * Example: [ns|name=attr]
00119    * Example: [ns|name~=attr]
00120    * @param string $name
00121    *  The attribute name.
00122    * @param string $ns
00123    *  The namespace identifier (not the URI).
00124    * @param string $value
00125    *  The value of the attribute, if given.
00126    * @param int $operation
00127    *  The operation to be used for matching. See {@link CssEventHandler}
00128    *  constants for a list of supported operations.
00129    */
00130   public function attributeNS($name, $ns, $value = NULL, $operation = CssEventHandler::isExactly);
00131   /**
00132    * Handle a pseudo-class.
00133    * Example: :name(value)
00134    * @param string $name
00135    *  The pseudo-class name.
00136    * @param string $value
00137    *  The value, if one is found.
00138    */
00139   public function pseudoClass($name, $value = NULL); //:name(value)
00140   /**
00141    * Handle a pseudo-element.
00142    * Example: ::name
00143    * @param string $name
00144    *  The pseudo-element name.
00145    */
00146   public function pseudoElement($name); // ::name
00147   /**
00148    * Handle a direct descendant combinator.
00149    * Example: >
00150    */
00151   public function directDescendant(); // >
00152   /**
00153    * Handle a adjacent combinator.
00154    * Example: +
00155    */
00156   public function adjacent(); // +
00157   /**
00158    * Handle an another-selector combinator.
00159    * Example: ,
00160    */
00161   public function anotherSelector(); // ,
00162   /**
00163    * Handle a sibling combinator.
00164    * Example: ~
00165    */
00166   public function sibling(); // ~ combinator
00167   /**
00168    * Handle an any-descendant combinator.
00169    * Example: ' '
00170    */
00171   public function anyDescendant(); // ' ' (space) operator.
00172   
00173 }
00174 
00175 /**
00176  * Tokens for CSS.
00177  * This class defines the recognized tokens for the parser, and also 
00178  * provides utility functions for error reporting.
00179  *
00180  * @ingroup querypath_css
00181  */
00182 final class CssToken {
00183   const char = 0;
00184   const star = 1;
00185   const rangle = 2;
00186   const dot = 3;
00187   const octo = 4;
00188   const rsquare = 5;
00189   const lsquare = 6;
00190   const colon = 7;
00191   const rparen = 8;
00192   const lparen = 9;
00193   const plus = 10;
00194   const tilde = 11;
00195   const eq = 12;
00196   const pipe = 13;
00197   const comma = 14;
00198   const white = 15;
00199   const quote = 16;
00200   const squote = 17;
00201   const bslash = 18;
00202   const carat = 19;
00203   const dollar = 20;
00204   const at = 21; // This is not in the spec. Apparently, old broken CSS uses it.
00205   
00206   // In legal range for string.
00207   const stringLegal = 99;
00208   
00209   /**
00210    * Get a name for a given constant. Used for error handling.
00211    */  
00212   static function name($const_int) {
00213     $a = array('character', 'star', 'right angle bracket', 
00214       'dot', 'octothorp', 'right square bracket', 'left square bracket',
00215       'colon', 'right parenthesis', 'left parenthesis', 'plus', 'tilde',
00216       'equals', 'vertical bar', 'comma', 'space', 'quote', 'single quote',
00217       'backslash', 'carat', 'dollar', 'at');
00218     if (isset($a[$const_int]) && is_numeric($const_int)) {
00219       return $a[$const_int];
00220     }
00221     elseif ($const_int == 99) {
00222       return 'a legal non-alphanumeric character';
00223     }
00224     elseif ($const_int == FALSE) {
00225       return 'end of file';
00226     }
00227     return sprintf('illegal character (%s)', $const_int);
00228   }
00229 }
00230 
00231 /**
00232  * Parse a CSS selector.
00233  *
00234  * In CSS, a selector is used to identify which element or elements
00235  * in a DOM are being selected for the application of a particular style.
00236  * Effectively, selectors function as a query language for a structured
00237  * document -- almost always HTML or XML.
00238  *
00239  * This class provides an event-based parser for CSS selectors. It can be
00240  * used, for example, as a basis for writing a DOM query engine based on
00241  * CSS.
00242  *
00243  * @ingroup querypath_css
00244  */
00245 class CssParser {
00246   protected $scanner = NULL;
00247   protected $buffer = '';
00248   protected $handler = NULL;
00249   protected $strict = FALSE;
00250   
00251   protected $DEBUG = FALSE;
00252   
00253   /**
00254    * Construct a new CSS parser object. This will attempt to
00255    * parse the string as a CSS selector. As it parses, it will 
00256    * send events to the CssEventHandler implementation.
00257    */
00258   public function __construct($string, CssEventHandler $handler) {
00259     $this->originalString = $string;
00260     $is = new CssInputStream($string);
00261     $this->scanner = new CssScanner($is);
00262     $this->handler = $handler;
00263   }
00264   
00265   /**
00266    * Parse the selector.
00267    *
00268    * This begins an event-based parsing process that will 
00269    * fire events as the selector is handled. A CssEventHandler
00270    * implementation will be responsible for handling the events.
00271    * @throws CssParseException
00272    */
00273   public function parse() {
00274 
00275     $this->scanner->nextToken();
00276     while ($this->scanner->token !== FALSE) {
00277       // Primitive recursion detection.
00278       $position = $this->scanner->position();
00279       
00280       if ($this->DEBUG) {
00281         print "PARSE " . $this->scanner->token. "\n";
00282       }
00283       $this->selector();
00284       
00285       $finalPosition = $this->scanner->position();
00286       
00287       if ($this->scanner->token !== FALSE && $finalPosition == $position) {
00288         // If we get here, then the scanner did not pop a single character
00289         // off of the input stream during a full run of the parser, which
00290         // means that the current input does not match any recognizable
00291         // pattern.
00292         throw new CssParseException('CSS selector is not well formed.');
00293       }
00294       
00295     }
00296     
00297   }
00298   
00299   /**
00300    * A restricted parser that can only parse simple selectors.
00301    * The pseudoClass handler for this parser will throw an 
00302    * exception if it encounters a pseudo-element or the
00303    * negation pseudo-class.
00304    *
00305    * @deprecated This is not used anywhere in QueryPath and
00306    *  may be removed.
00307    *//*
00308   public function parseSimpleSelector() {
00309     while ($this->scanner->token !== FALSE) {
00310       if ($this->DEBUG) print "SIMPLE SELECTOR\n";
00311       $this->allElements();
00312       $this->elementName();
00313       $this->elementClass();
00314       $this->elementID();
00315       $this->pseudoClass(TRUE); // Operate in restricted mode.
00316       $this->attribute();
00317       
00318       // TODO: Need to add failure conditions here.
00319     }
00320   }*/
00321   
00322   /**
00323    * Handle an entire CSS selector.
00324    */
00325   private function selector() {
00326     if ($this->DEBUG) print "SELECTOR{$this->scanner->position()}\n";
00327     $this->consumeWhitespace(); // Remove leading whitespace
00328     $this->simpleSelectors();
00329     $this->combinator();
00330   }
00331   
00332   /**
00333    * Consume whitespace and return a count of the number of whitespace consumed.
00334    */
00335   private function consumeWhitespace() {
00336     if ($this->DEBUG) print "CONSUME WHITESPACE\n";
00337     $white = 0;
00338     while ($this->scanner->token == CssToken::white) {
00339       $this->scanner->nextToken();
00340       ++$white;
00341     }
00342     return $white;
00343   }
00344   
00345   /**
00346    * Handle one of the five combinators: '>', '+', ' ', '~', and ','.
00347    * This will call the appropriate event handlers.
00348    * @see CssEventHandler::directDescendant(),
00349    * @see CssEventHandler::adjacent(), 
00350    * @see CssEventHandler::anyDescendant(),
00351    * @see CssEventHandler::anotherSelector().
00352    */
00353   private function combinator() {
00354     if ($this->DEBUG) print "COMBINATOR\n";
00355     /*
00356      * Problem: ' ' and ' > ' are both valid combinators.
00357      * So we have to track whitespace consumption to see
00358      * if we are hitting the ' ' combinator or if the 
00359      * selector just has whitespace padding another combinator.
00360      */
00361     
00362     // Flag to indicate that post-checks need doing
00363     $inCombinator = FALSE; 
00364     $white = $this->consumeWhitespace();
00365     $t = $this->scanner->token;    
00366         
00367     if ($t == CssToken::rangle) {
00368       $this->handler->directDescendant();
00369       $this->scanner->nextToken();
00370       $inCombinator = TRUE;
00371       //$this->simpleSelectors();
00372     }
00373     elseif ($t == CssToken::plus) {
00374       $this->handler->adjacent();
00375       $this->scanner->nextToken();
00376       $inCombinator = TRUE;
00377       //$this->simpleSelectors();
00378     }
00379     elseif ($t == CssToken::comma) {
00380       $this->handler->anotherSelector();
00381       $this->scanner->nextToken();
00382       $inCombinator = TRUE;
00383       //$this->scanner->selectors();
00384     }
00385     elseif ($t == CssToken::tilde) {
00386       $this->handler->sibling();
00387       $this->scanner->nextToken();
00388       $inCombinator = TRUE;
00389     }
00390 
00391     // Check that we don't get two combinators in a row.
00392     if ($inCombinator) {
00393       $white = 0;
00394       if ($this->DEBUG) print "COMBINATOR: " . CssToken::name($t) . "\n";
00395       $this->consumeWhitespace();
00396       if ($this->isCombinator($this->scanner->token)) {
00397         throw new CssParseException("Illegal combinator: Cannot have two combinators in sequence.");
00398       }
00399     }
00400     // Check to see if we have whitespace combinator:
00401     elseif ($white > 0) {
00402       if ($this->DEBUG) print "COMBINATOR: any descendant\n";
00403       $inCombinator = TRUE;
00404       $this->handler->anyDescendant();
00405     }
00406     else {
00407       if ($this->DEBUG) print "COMBINATOR: no combinator found.\n";
00408     }
00409   }
00410   
00411   /**
00412    * Check if the token is a combinator.
00413    */
00414   private function isCombinator($tok) {
00415     $combinators = array(CssToken::plus, CssToken::rangle, CssToken::comma, CssToken::tilde);
00416     return in_array($tok, $combinators);
00417   }
00418   
00419   /**
00420    * Handle a simple selector.
00421    */
00422   private function simpleSelectors() {
00423     if ($this->DEBUG) print "SIMPLE SELECTOR\n";
00424     $this->allElements();
00425     $this->elementName();
00426     $this->elementClass();
00427     $this->elementID();
00428     $this->pseudoClass();
00429     $this->attribute();
00430   }
00431   
00432   /**
00433    * Handles CSS ID selectors.
00434    * This will call CssEventHandler::elementID().
00435    */
00436   private function elementID() {
00437     if ($this->DEBUG) print "ELEMENT ID\n";
00438     if ($this->scanner->token == CssToken::octo) {
00439       $this->scanner->nextToken();
00440       if ($this->scanner->token !== CssToken::char) {
00441         throw new CssParseException("Expected string after #");
00442       }
00443       $id = $this->scanner->getNameString();
00444       $this->handler->elementID($id);
00445     }
00446   }
00447   
00448   /**
00449    * Handles CSS class selectors.
00450    * This will call the CssEventHandler::elementClass() method.
00451    */
00452   private function elementClass() {
00453     if ($this->DEBUG) print "ELEMENT CLASS\n";
00454     if ($this->scanner->token == CssToken::dot) {
00455       $this->scanner->nextToken();
00456       $this->consumeWhitespace(); // We're very fault tolerent. This should prob through error.
00457       $cssClass = $this->scanner->getNameString();
00458       $this->handler->elementClass($cssClass);
00459     }
00460   }
00461   
00462   /**
00463    * Handle a pseudo-class and pseudo-element.
00464    *
00465    * CSS 3 selectors support separate pseudo-elements, using :: instead
00466    * of : for separator. This is now supported, and calls the pseudoElement
00467    * handler, CssEventHandler::pseudoElement().
00468    *
00469    * This will call CssEventHandler::pseudoClass() when a
00470    * pseudo-class is parsed.
00471    */
00472   private function pseudoClass($restricted = FALSE) {
00473     if ($this->DEBUG) print "PSEUDO-CLASS\n";
00474     if ($this->scanner->token == CssToken::colon) {
00475 
00476       // Check for CSS 3 pseudo element:
00477       $isPseudoElement = FALSE;
00478       if ($this->scanner->nextToken() === CssToken::colon) {
00479         $isPseudoElement = TRUE;
00480         $this->scanner->nextToken();
00481       }
00482       
00483       $name = $this->scanner->getNameString();
00484       if ($restricted && $name == 'not') {
00485         throw new CssParseException("The 'not' pseudo-class is illegal in this context.");
00486       }
00487       
00488       $value = NULL;
00489       if ($this->scanner->token == CssToken::lparen) {
00490         if ($isPseudoElement) {
00491           throw new CssParseException("Illegal left paren. Pseudo-Element cannot have arguments.");
00492         }
00493         $value = $this->pseudoClassValue();
00494       }
00495       
00496       // FIXME: This should throw errors when pseudo element has values.
00497       if ($isPseudoElement) {
00498         if ($restricted) {
00499           throw new CssParseException("Pseudo-Elements are illegal in this context.");
00500         }
00501         $this->handler->pseudoElement($name);
00502         $this->consumeWhitespace();
00503         
00504         // Per the spec, pseudo-elements must be the last items in a selector, so we 
00505         // check to make sure that we are either at the end of the stream or that a
00506         // new selector is starting. Only one pseudo-element is allowed per selector.
00507         if ($this->scanner->token !== FALSE && $this->scanner->token !== CssToken::comma) {
00508           throw new CssParseException("A Pseudo-Element must be the last item in a selector.");
00509         }
00510       } 
00511       else {
00512         $this->handler->pseudoClass($name, $value);
00513       }
00514     }
00515   }
00516   
00517   /**
00518    * Get the value of a pseudo-classes.
00519    * 
00520    * @return string
00521    *  Returns the value found from a pseudo-class.
00522    *
00523    * @todo Pseudoclasses can be passed pseudo-elements and 
00524    *  other pseudo-classes as values, which means :pseudo(::pseudo)
00525    *  is legal.
00526    */
00527   private function pseudoClassValue() {
00528     if ($this->scanner->token == CssToken::lparen) {
00529       $buf = '';
00530 
00531       // For now, just leave pseudoClass value vague.
00532       /*
00533       // We have to peek to see if next char is a colon because
00534       // pseudo-classes and pseudo-elements are legal strings here.
00535       print $this->scanner->peek();
00536       if ($this->scanner->peek() == ':') {
00537         print "Is pseudo\n";
00538         $this->scanner->nextToken();
00539       
00540         // Pseudo class
00541         if ($this->scanner->token == CssToken::colon) {
00542           $buf .= ':';
00543           $this->scanner->nextToken();
00544           // Pseudo element
00545           if ($this->scanner->token == CssToken::colon) {
00546             $buf .= ':';
00547             $this->scanner->nextToken();
00548           }
00549           // Ident 
00550           $buf .= $this->scanner->getNameString();
00551         }
00552       }
00553       else {
00554         print "fetching string.\n";
00555         $buf .= $this->scanner->getQuotedString();
00556         if ($this->scanner->token != CssToken::rparen) {
00557           $this->throwError(CssToken::rparen, $this->scanner->token);
00558         }
00559         $this->scanner->nextToken();
00560       }
00561       return $buf;
00562       */
00563       $buf .= $this->scanner->getQuotedString();
00564       return $buf;
00565     }
00566   }
00567   
00568   /**
00569    * Handle element names.
00570    * This will call the CssEventHandler::elementName().
00571    *
00572    * This handles:
00573    * <code>
00574    *  name (CssEventHandler::element())
00575    *  |name (CssEventHandler::element())
00576    *  ns|name (CssEventHandler::elementNS())
00577    *  ns|* (CssEventHandler::elementNS())
00578    * </code>
00579    */
00580   private function elementName() {
00581     if ($this->DEBUG) print "ELEMENT NAME\n";
00582     if ($this->scanner->token === CssToken::pipe) {
00583       // We have '|name', which is equiv to 'name'
00584       $this->scanner->nextToken();
00585       $this->consumeWhitespace();
00586       $elementName =  $this->scanner->getNameString();
00587       $this->handler->element($elementName);
00588     }
00589     elseif ($this->scanner->token === CssToken::char) {
00590       $elementName =  $this->scanner->getNameString();
00591       if ($this->scanner->token == CssToken::pipe) {
00592         // Get ns|name
00593         $elementNS = $elementName;
00594         $this->scanner->nextToken();
00595         $this->consumeWhitespace();
00596         if ($this->scanner->token === CssToken::star) {
00597           // We have ns|* 
00598           $this->handler->anyElementInNS($elementNS);
00599           $this->scanner->nextToken();
00600         }
00601         elseif ($this->scanner->token !== CssToken::char) {
00602           $this->throwError(CssToken::char, $this->scanner->token);
00603         }
00604         else {
00605           $elementName = $this->scanner->getNameString();
00606           // We have ns|name
00607           $this->handler->elementNS($elementName, $elementNS);
00608         }
00609         
00610       }
00611       else {
00612         $this->handler->element($elementName);
00613       }
00614     }
00615   }
00616   
00617   /**
00618    * Check for all elements designators. Due to the new CSS 3 namespace
00619    * support, this is slightly more complicated, now, as it handles 
00620    * the *|name and *|* cases as well as *.
00621    *
00622    * Calls CssEventHandler::anyElement() or CssEventHandler::elementName().
00623    */
00624   private function allElements() {
00625     if ($this->scanner->token === CssToken::star) {
00626       $this->scanner->nextToken();
00627       if ($this->scanner->token === CssToken::pipe) {
00628         $this->scanner->nextToken();
00629         if ($this->scanner->token === CssToken::star) {
00630           // We got *|*. According to spec, this requires
00631           // that the element has a namespace, so we pass it on
00632           // to the handler:
00633           $this->scanner->nextToken();
00634           $this->handler->anyElementInNS('*');
00635         }
00636         else {
00637           // We got *|name, which means the name MUST be in a namespce,
00638           // so we pass this off to elementNameNS().
00639           $name = $this->scanner->getNameString();
00640           $this->handler->elementNS($name, '*');
00641         }
00642       }
00643       else {
00644         $this->handler->anyElement();
00645       }
00646     }
00647   }
00648   
00649   /**
00650    * Handler an attribute.
00651    * An attribute can be in one of two forms:
00652    * <code>[attrName]</code>
00653    * or 
00654    * <code>[attrName="AttrValue"]</code>
00655    *
00656    * This may call the following event handlers: CssEventHandler::attribute().
00657    */
00658   private function attribute() {
00659     if($this->scanner->token == CssToken::lsquare) {
00660       $attrVal = $op = $ns = NULL;
00661       
00662       $this->scanner->nextToken();
00663       $this->consumeWhitespace();
00664       
00665       if ($this->scanner->token === CssToken::at) {
00666         if ($this->strict) {
00667           throw new CssParseException('The @ is illegal in attributes.');
00668         }
00669         else {
00670           $this->scanner->nextToken();
00671           $this->consumeWhitespace();
00672         }
00673       }
00674       
00675       if ($this->scanner->token === CssToken::star) {
00676         // Global namespace... requires that attr be prefixed,
00677         // so we pass this on to a namespace handler.
00678         $ns = '*';
00679         $this->scanner->nextToken();
00680       }
00681       if ($this->scanner->token === CssToken::pipe) {
00682         // Skip this. It's a global namespace.
00683         $this->scanner->nextToken();
00684         $this->consumeWhitespace();
00685       }
00686       
00687       $attrName = $this->scanner->getNameString();
00688       $this->consumeWhitespace();
00689       
00690       // Check for namespace attribute: ns|attr. We have to peek() to make 
00691       // sure that we haven't hit the |= operator, which looks the same.
00692       if ($this->scanner->token === CssToken::pipe && $this->scanner->peek() !== '=') {
00693         // We have a namespaced attribute. 
00694         $ns = $attrName;
00695         $this->scanner->nextToken();
00696         $attrName = $this->scanner->getNameString();
00697         $this->consumeWhitespace();
00698       }
00699       
00700       // Note: We require that operators do not have spaces 
00701       // between characters, e.g. ~= , not ~ =.
00702 
00703       // Get the operator:
00704       switch ($this->scanner->token) {
00705         case CssToken::eq:
00706           $this->consumeWhitespace();
00707           $op = CssEventHandler::isExactly;
00708           break;
00709         case CssToken::tilde:
00710           if ($this->scanner->nextToken() !== CssToken::eq) {
00711             $this->throwError(CssToken::eq, $this->scanner->token);
00712           }
00713           $op = CssEventHandler::containsWithSpace;
00714           break;
00715         case CssToken::pipe:
00716           if ($this->scanner->nextToken() !== CssToken::eq) {
00717             $this->throwError(CssToken::eq, $this->scanner->token);
00718           }
00719           $op = CssEventHandler::containsWithHyphen;
00720           break;
00721         case CssToken::star:
00722           if ($this->scanner->nextToken() !== CssToken::eq) {
00723             $this->throwError(CssToken::eq, $this->scanner->token);
00724           }
00725           $op = CssEventHandler::containsInString;
00726           break;
00727         case CssToken::dollar;
00728           if ($this->scanner->nextToken() !== CssToken::eq) {
00729             $this->throwError(CssToken::eq, $this->scanner->token);
00730           }
00731           $op = CssEventHandler::endsWith;
00732           break;
00733         case CssToken::carat:
00734           if ($this->scanner->nextToken() !== CssToken::eq) {
00735             $this->throwError(CssToken::eq, $this->scanner->token);
00736           }
00737           $op = CssEventHandler::beginsWith;
00738           break;
00739       }
00740       
00741       if (isset($op)) {
00742         // Consume '=' and go on.
00743         $this->scanner->nextToken();
00744         $this->consumeWhitespace();
00745         
00746         // So... here we have a problem. The grammer suggests that the
00747         // value here is String1 or String2, both of which are enclosed
00748         // in quotes of some sort, and both of which allow lots of special 
00749         // characters. But the spec itself includes examples like this:
00750         //   [lang=fr]
00751         // So some bareword support is assumed. To get around this, we assume
00752         // that bare words follow the NAME rules, while quoted strings follow
00753         // the String1/String2 rules.
00754         
00755         if ($this->scanner->token === CssToken::quote || $this->scanner->token === CssToken::squote) {
00756           $attrVal = $this->scanner->getQuotedString();
00757         }
00758         else {
00759           $attrVal = $this->scanner->getNameString();
00760         }
00761         
00762         if ($this->DEBUG) {
00763           print "ATTR: $attrVal AND OP: $op\n";
00764         }
00765       }
00766       
00767       $this->consumeWhitespace();
00768       
00769       if ($this->scanner->token != CssToken::rsquare) {
00770         $this->throwError(CssToken::rsquare, $this->scanner->token);
00771       }
00772       
00773       if (isset($ns)) {
00774         $this->handler->attributeNS($attrName, $ns, $attrVal, $op);
00775       }
00776       elseif (isset($attrVal)) {
00777         $this->handler->attribute($attrName, $attrVal, $op);
00778       }
00779       else {
00780         $this->handler->attribute($attrName);
00781       }
00782       $this->scanner->nextToken();
00783     }
00784   }
00785   
00786   /**
00787    * Utility for throwing a consistantly-formatted parse error.
00788    */
00789   private function throwError($expected, $got) {
00790     $filter = sprintf('Expected %s, got %s', CssToken::name($expected), CssToken::name($got));
00791     throw new CssParseException($filter);
00792   }
00793   
00794 }
00795 
00796 /**
00797  * Scanner for CSS selector parsing.
00798  *
00799  * This provides a simple scanner for traversing an input stream.
00800  *
00801  * @ingroup querypath_css
00802  */
00803 final class CssScanner {
00804   var $is = NULL;
00805   public $value = NULL;
00806   public $token = NULL;
00807   
00808   var $recurse = FALSE;
00809   var $it = 0;
00810   
00811   /**
00812    * Given a new input stream, tokenize the CSS selector string.
00813    * @see CssInputStream
00814    * @param CssInputStream $in
00815    *  An input stream to be scanned.
00816    */
00817   public function __construct(CssInputStream $in) {
00818     $this->is = $in;
00819   }
00820   
00821   /**
00822    * Return the position of the reader in the string.
00823    */
00824   public function position() {
00825     return $this->is->position;
00826   }
00827   
00828   /**
00829    * See the next char without removing it from the stack.
00830    *
00831    * @return char
00832    *  Returns the next character on the stack.
00833    */
00834   public function peek() {
00835     return $this->is->peek();
00836   }
00837   
00838   /**
00839    * Get the next token in the input stream.
00840    *
00841    * This sets the current token to the value of the next token in 
00842    * the stream.
00843    *
00844    * @return int
00845    *  Returns an int value corresponding to one of the CssToken constants,
00846    *  or FALSE if the end of the string is reached. (Remember to use
00847    *  strong equality checking on FALSE, since 0 is a valid token id.)
00848    */
00849   public function nextToken() {
00850     $tok = -1;
00851     ++$this->it;
00852     if ($this->is->isEmpty()) {
00853       if ($this->recurse) {
00854         throw new Exception("Recursion error detected at iteration " . $this->it . '.');
00855         exit();
00856       }
00857       //print "{$this->it}: All done\n";
00858       $this->recurse = TRUE;
00859       $this->token = FALSE;
00860       return FALSE;
00861     }
00862     $ch = $this->is->consume();
00863     //print __FUNCTION__ . " Testing $ch.\n";
00864     if (ctype_space($ch)) {
00865       $this->value = ' '; // Collapse all WS to a space.
00866       $this->token = $tok = CssToken::white;
00867       //$ch = $this->is->consume();
00868       return $tok;
00869     }
00870     
00871     if (ctype_alnum($ch) || $ch == '-' || $ch == '_') {
00872       // It's a character
00873       $this->value = $ch; //strtolower($ch);
00874       $this->token = $tok = CssToken::char;
00875       return $tok;
00876     }
00877     
00878     $this->value = $ch;
00879     
00880     switch($ch) {
00881       case '*':
00882         $tok = CssToken::star;
00883         break;
00884       case chr(ord('>')):
00885         $tok = CssToken::rangle;
00886         break;
00887       case '.':
00888         $tok = CssToken::dot;
00889         break;
00890       case '#':
00891         $tok = CssToken::octo;
00892         break;
00893       case '[':
00894         $tok = CssToken::lsquare;
00895         break;
00896       case ']':
00897         $tok = CssToken::rsquare;
00898         break;
00899       case ':':
00900         $tok = CssToken::colon;
00901         break;
00902       case '(':
00903         $tok = CssToken::lparen;
00904         break;
00905       case ')':
00906         $tok = CssToken::rparen;
00907         break;
00908       case '+':
00909         $tok = CssToken::plus;
00910         break;
00911       case '~':
00912         $tok = CssToken::tilde;
00913         break;
00914       case '=':
00915         $tok = CssToken::eq;
00916         break;
00917       case '|':
00918         $tok = CssToken::pipe;
00919         break;
00920       case ',':
00921         $tok = CssToken::comma;
00922         break;
00923       case chr(34):
00924         $tok = CssToken::quote;
00925         break;
00926       case "'":
00927         $tok = CssToken::squote;
00928         break;
00929       case '\\':
00930         $tok = CssToken::bslash;
00931         break;
00932       case '^':
00933         $tok = CssToken::carat;
00934         break;
00935       case '$':
00936         $tok = CssToken::dollar;
00937         break;
00938       case '@':
00939         $tok = CssToken::at;
00940         break;
00941     }
00942     
00943     
00944     // Catch all characters that are legal within strings.
00945     if ($tok == -1) {
00946       // TODO: This should be UTF-8 compatible, but PHP doesn't
00947       // have a native UTF-8 string. Should we use external
00948       // mbstring library?
00949 
00950       $ord = ord($ch);
00951       // Characters in this pool are legal for use inside of
00952       // certain strings. Extended ASCII is used here, though I
00953       // Don't know if these are really legal.
00954       if (($ord >= 32 && $ord <= 126) || ($ord >= 128 && $ord <= 255)) {
00955         $tok = CssToken::stringLegal;
00956       }
00957       else {
00958         throw new CSSParseException('Illegal character found in stream: ' . $ord);
00959       }
00960     }
00961     
00962     $this->token = $tok;
00963     return $tok;
00964   }
00965   
00966   /**
00967    * Get a name string from the input stream.
00968    * A name string must be composed of 
00969    * only characters defined in CssToken:char: -_a-zA-Z0-9
00970    */
00971   public function getNameString() {
00972     $buf = '';
00973     while ($this->token === CssToken::char) {
00974       $buf .= $this->value;
00975       $this->nextToken();
00976       //print '_';
00977     }
00978     return $buf;
00979   }
00980   
00981   /**
00982    * This gets a string with any legal 'string' characters.
00983    * See CSS Selectors specification, section 11, for the 
00984    * definition of string.
00985    *
00986    * This will check for string1, string2, and the case where a 
00987    * string is unquoted (Oddly absent from the "official" grammar, 
00988    * though such strings are present as examples in the spec.)
00989    *
00990    * Note:
00991    * Though the grammar supplied by CSS 3 Selectors section 11 does not
00992    * address the contents of a pseudo-class value, the spec itself indicates
00993    * that a pseudo-class value is a "value between parenthesis" [6.6]. The 
00994    * examples given use URLs among other things, making them closer to the 
00995    * definition of 'string' than to 'name'. So we handle them here as strings.
00996    */
00997   public function getQuotedString() {
00998     if ($this->token == CssToken::quote || $this->token == CssToken::squote || $this->token == CssToken::lparen) {
00999       $end = ($this->token == CssToken::lparen) ? CssToken::rparen : $this->token;
01000       $buf = '';
01001       $escape = FALSE;
01002       
01003       $this->nextToken(); // Skip the opening quote/paren
01004       
01005       // The second conjunct is probably not necessary.
01006       while ($this->token !== FALSE && $this->token > -1) {
01007         //print "Char: $this->value \n";
01008         if ($this->token == CssToken::bslash && !$escape) {
01009           // XXX: The backslash (\) is removed here.
01010           // Turn on escaping.
01011           //$buf .= $this->value;
01012           $escape = TRUE;
01013         }
01014         elseif ($escape) {
01015           // Turn off escaping
01016           $buf .= $this->value;
01017           $escape = FALSE;
01018         }
01019         elseif ($this->token === $end) {
01020           // At end of string; skip token and break.
01021           $this->nextToken();
01022           break;
01023         }
01024         else {
01025           // Append char.
01026           $buf .= $this->value;
01027         }
01028         $this->nextToken();
01029       }
01030       return $buf;
01031     }
01032   }
01033   
01034   /**
01035    * Get a string from the input stream.
01036    * This is a convenience function for getting a string of 
01037    * characters that are either alphanumber or whitespace. See
01038    * the CssToken::white and CssToken::char definitions.
01039    *
01040    * @deprecated This is not used anywhere in QueryPath.
01041    *//*
01042   public function getStringPlusWhitespace() {
01043     $buf = '';
01044     if($this->token === FALSE) {return '';}
01045     while ($this->token === CssToken::char || $this->token == CssToken::white) {
01046       $buf .= $this->value;
01047       $this->nextToken();
01048     }
01049     return $buf;
01050   }*/
01051   
01052 }
01053 
01054 /**
01055  * Simple wrapper to turn a string into an input stream.
01056  * This provides a standard interface on top of an array of 
01057  * characters.
01058  */
01059 class CssInputStream {
01060   protected $stream = NULL;
01061   public $position = 0;
01062   /**
01063    * Build a new CSS input stream from a string.
01064    * 
01065    * @param string
01066    *  String to turn into an input stream.
01067    */
01068   function __construct($string) {
01069     $this->stream = str_split($string);
01070   }
01071   /**
01072    * Look ahead one character.
01073    *
01074    * @return char
01075    *  Returns the next character, but does not remove it from
01076    *  the stream.
01077    */
01078   function peek() {
01079     return $this->stream[0];
01080   }
01081   /**
01082    * Get the next unconsumed character in the stream.
01083    * This will remove that character from the front of the
01084    * stream and return it.
01085    */
01086   function consume() {
01087     $ret = array_shift($this->stream);
01088     if (!empty($ret)) {
01089       $this->position++;
01090     }
01091     return $ret;
01092   }
01093   /**
01094    * Check if the stream is empty.
01095    * @return boolean
01096    *   Returns TRUE when the stream is empty, FALSE otherwise.
01097    */
01098   function isEmpty() {
01099     return count($this->stream) == 0;
01100   }
01101 }
01102 
01103 /**
01104  * Exception indicating an error in CSS parsing.
01105  *
01106  * @ingroup querypath_css
01107  */
01108 class CSSParseException extends EXCEPTION {}
